attributes.action: EU Referendum vote should be taken again. UK citizens aged 16/16+ should vote.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum voting affects everyone in the UK. Citizens aged 16 and over should be able to vote, let their voice be heard. When the Scottish Referendum happened, 16 years old voted. Why didn't they vote for this referendum.

rejection.details:
The EU referendum has already taken place. It is therefore no longer possible for the franchise (the groups of people who are entitled to vote) to be changed.

If you would like the UK voting age to be lowered to 16, you might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/119769
